comments:
Using I200411240800

Got a NPE in class WorkingSetModel:
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.workingsets.WorkingSetModel.<init>(WorkingSetModel.java)
	at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.wizards.JavaProjectWizardFoldersPage$PackageExplorer.createPartControl(JavaProjectWizardFoldersPage.java)
	at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.wizards.JavaProjectWizardFoldersPage$PackageExplorer.<init>(JavaProjectWizardFoldersPage.java:760)
	at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.wizards.JavaProjectWizardFoldersPage.createControl(JavaProjectWizardFoldersPage.java:1441)
	at org.eclipse.jface.wizard.Wizard.createPageControls(Wizard.java:179)
	at org.eclipse.jface.wizard.WizardDialog.createPageControls(WizardDialog.java:605)
	at org.eclipse.jface.wizard.WizardDialog.createContents(WizardDialog.java:496)
	at org.eclipse.jface.window.Window.create(Window.java:375)
	at org.eclipse.jface.dialogs.Dialog.create(Dialog.java:983)
...

because 'fOthersWorkingSetUpdater' is null when invoking method init.

'fOthersWorkingSetUpdater' will only be initialized when using the second
constructor.

Fixed for M5. The updater is initialized as a isde effect to adding the working
set to the manager.

hard to verify without steps... but here comes my manual static analysis:


- 'fOthersWorkingSetUpdater' is only initialized upon receiving a
CHANGE_WORKING_SET_UPDATER_INSTALLED property change.

- In the 0-arg-ctor, a new IWorkingSet with ID OthersWorkingSetUpdater.ID is
created, which trigger such a property change *if* the OthersWorkingSetUpdater
is freshly created, but not otherwise.

Since WorkingSetModel seems to be the only place where an IWorkingSet is created
with said Id, this is probably safe, as long as there is just one
WorkingSetModel. (Lemma 1)

- In the 1-arg-ctor restoring from an IMemento, restoreState is called on the
local working set manager, triggering the same
AbstractWorkingSetManager.internalAddWorkingSet call that results in said
property change event.

PackageExplorerPart seems to manage the singleton instance of WorkingSetModel,
which ensures that never two Models exist at the same time. (Lemma 2)

-> Given 1 & 2, I believe this is fixed :-)
